intro: Pupalia robecchii, commonly known as the Indian borage or wild thyme, is a flowering plant native to southern and eastern Asia. It is a small shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30 cm, featuring aromatic, glandular leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone areas. It is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies. Pupalia robecchii is also an attractive ornamental plant due to its compact growth and fragrant foliage.
